replies.body: Is this a serious question, or is "stupid as fuck inbred retards" a compliment?
That's why you got a ban

> [{quoted}](name=PickIe Rickkk,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXHEJgwj,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-03-26T22:16:47.508+0000)
>
> it's a compliment compared to what they actually are

Wow you put a lot of yourself behind this other person you claim was the one who got punished. It looks like you vehemently believe in what was said in the logs. That makes it kind of obvious dude....

It's like people are blind to their own behaviour, or just lose the ability to read their chat logs.

Ban is justified, the evidence is right there, if he was actually a friend you should be able to explain this to him yourself.

Weird how these people always think nothing is wrong with their behavior.

Unsure if denial is the only way they can cope with themselves, or if they are really taught to act like this.

I think the part where he called his teammates "inbred retards" is the exact moment the system kicked into effect and skipped chat bans, straight to a 14-day.

Whilst I don't advocate for toxicity, I also don't agree that a company should ban it's customers to trash talk.

> [{quoted}](name=P3rspective,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXHEJgwj,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-03-27T13:56:20.603+0000)
>
> I think the part where he called his teammates "inbred retards" is the exact moment the system kicked into effect and skipped chat bans, straight to a 14-day.
> 
> Whilst I don't advocate for toxicity, I also don't agree that a company should ban it's customers to trash talk.

Maybe it's just me but I fail to see how any of the stuff in this log qualifies as trash talk. To quote [Baron Barian](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/kWXhQ1c1-banned-for-2-weeks-hahahaha-wtf?sort_type=recent&comment=0009): 

>There's trash talking, and then there's talking like trash. Don't think twice before you talk. Think 5 times.

> [{quoted}](name=Prandine,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXHEJgwj,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2018-03-27T14:07:05.851+0000)
>
> Maybe it's just me but I fail to see how any of the stuff in this log qualifies as trash talk. To quote [Baron Barian](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/kWXhQ1c1-banned-for-2-weeks-hahahaha-wtf?sort_type=recent&comment=0009):

I would like to advise you to look up what "trash talk" actually means, please.

Thanks! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

trash talk

noun
1.
insulting or boastful speech intended to demoralize, intimidate, or humiliate someone, especially an opponent in an athletic contest.

> [{quoted}](name=Abraxus follower,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXHEJgwj,comment-id=0004000000000001,timestamp=2018-03-27T16:47:46.779+0000)
>
> trash talk
> 
> noun
> 1.
> insulting or boastful speech intended to demoralize, intimidate, or humiliate someone, especially an opponent in an athletic contest.

Exactly. And then we got Yerro over here, saying trash talk and insults are completely different. I'm still dumbfounded that people refuse to accept the definition of the word.

> [{quoted}](name=P3rspective,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXHEJgwj,comment-id=00040000000000010000,timestamp=2018-03-27T16:53:46.387+0000)
>
> Exactly. And then we got Yerro over here, saying trash talk and insults are completely different. I'm still dumbfounded that people refuse to accept the definition of the word.

You couldn't even get through the first sentence? If I use insult as part of the definition of trash talk, how is an insult different from trash talk when I'm using it as part of it's definition?

> [{quoted}](name=YerroFever,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXHEJgwj,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T16:41:24.819+0000)
>
> I don't know about what kind of competitive environment you are used to but I played team sports and trash talk usually involves witty or clever remarks that are insults to an opponent's level of skill or an over the top boast about their own skill.

EDIT: also, it's insanely funny that the definition quoted includes both insults or boasts and so does my definition and you say it's completely different. IMO, my definition is more fine tuned than the dictionary definition quoted and it seems to fit the situations that you see in both real sports and in esports.

> [{quoted}](name=P3rspective,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXHEJgwj,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T14:10:54.935+0000)
>
> I would like to advise you to look up what "trash talk" actually means, please.
> 
> Thanks! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

I don't know about what kind of competitive environment you are used to but I played team sports and trash talk usually involves witty or clever remarks that are insults to an opponent's level of skill or an over the top boast about their own skill. 

It's not calling someone a racial slur, it's not calling someone a homophobic slur, it's not telling someone to kill themselves, it's not calling them a retard, etc... It focuses on the game and the skill in the game. It isn't about them as a person. 

The line I personally draw is when the remark isn't focused on the skill or the game but becomes focused on the person. I know that just sounds weird and possibly confusing, but I'm going to try and explain through this chat log here.

> stay 1-4 ape

I don't think "ape" is trash talk at all. To me, this is on the line of racial slurs. Why? Because "monkey" has been used as a racial slur against black people. Some people try to say it's because they're unevolved as a person and are primitive, but that's also the same root cause as to why racists called black people monkeys. The racists believed blacks were unevolved and primitive compared to them. Even though on the face it's marginally different as an insult, the root of the insult is actually the same. 

"Stay 1-4" I would say this is less likely to be trash talk due to the addition of "ape" afterwards. If it was something like "Stay 1-4, at least if you get assists on my kills, I'll have the gold to be a hypercarry."  That's marginally better, but I still don't think it's a good thing to say because it's mean spirited particularly towards your own teammates. Why would you want to be mean to your teammates? Why not encourage them to contribute to team fights rather than be a pixel on the screen? 

Trash talking your own teammates just feels really self defeating to me. All you're doing is sabotaging teamwork in a game that thrives on teamwork.

>this fucking team is so fucking incredibly bad holy fuck

This isn't trash talking, it's just an insult to the team. It's an expression of frustration and an outburst from the person that can't handle adversity well. Shit happens, you should learn to adapt to overcome the obstacle, not sit there and insult people. 

Again, this is just sabotaging teamwork in a game that thrives on teamwork and is ultimately self defeating.

>listen to fucking pings you stupdi as fuck inbred retards

To me, this isn't trash talking either. The person is upset that people aren't listening to pings and insulting them by calling them "stupdi as fuck inbred retards." If the person said something like "pings aren't just eye and ear candy, I'm trying to tell you something quickly." Although there is sarcasm in "pings aren't just eye and ear candy" it's addressing the fact that the teammates are ignoring pings or are misunderstanding pings ie focused on the skill in the game and awareness in the game. Although this could be further taken an insult to someone's awareness or intelligence because of how they act in the game, but because it's about their skill in the game, I would consider that trash talking because the main focus is on the game and the skill involved in the game while the quote above focused on insulting someone. You don't have to take any steps in the quote to go from what is said to being an insult. It's just outright an insult.

Again, like the previous examples, it's self sabotage and self defeating because this game is about people working together to beat an opposing team of people working together.

The strategy of "divide and conquer" isn't an old one. If you can cause a rift in your enemy's forces, then you can conquer them easier. If you trash talk your own team, you are dividing your own team and letting your enemy conquer you easier. Many psychologists say long term negative reinforcement does not work and that positive reinforcement is the better long term solution. They say negative reinforcement is good at stopping bad behavior but positive reinforcement is good for continuing good behavior. 

So rather than trash talk my teammates for doing something bad and never saying anything good to them, like how this chat log reads, why not just say "I tried to warn you with my pings and you died because you ignored them" as your negative reinforcement and then when they do listen say something like "great call on not engaging there." This way you have a minor uncomfortable interaction because you are addressing something bad a person did publicly and it's public shaming (since it wasn't through a PM that they and only they saw and the rest of the team did), but then you are offering positive rewards through encouragement and compliments afterwards on behavior you like seeing in your teammates.

Now, granted I don't know if the team ever did anything that would warrant encouragement and compliments so I don't know if the chat log is skewed in the all negative direction because of the person typing or because of what happened in the game (or more specifically things that could get complimented didn't happen in the game so there is nothing to compliment), but that's just my take on trash talking and its effects on your teammates when you trash talk your ally rather than trash talk your enemy.

This is just my personal interpretation of what trash talking is. You are free to disagree with how I view trash talking and also my opinion on its effects on your own teammates when one trash talks one's own teammates.

This long and extensive essay with no TL;DR could have easily been avoided if you looked up the definition of trash talk. Misunderstanding of said definition could also lead to this lengthy beast.

> [{quoted}](name=P3rspective,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXHEJgwj,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T14:10:54.935+0000)
>
> I would like to advise you to look up what "trash talk" actually means, please.

Everybody knows that trash talk refers to bragging, insults or other mindgames against opponents. When you direct "trash talk" at teammates it stops being trash talk and becomes poor sportsmanship.

> [{quoted}](name=Abraxus follower,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXHEJgwj,comment-id=0004000000000001,timestamp=2018-03-27T16:47:46.779+0000)
>
> trash talk
> 
> noun
> 1.
> insulting or boastful speech intended to demoralize, intimidate, or humiliate someone, especially an opponent in an athletic contest.

You should never be attempting to "demoralize, intimidate, or humiliate" your own teammate. Anyone who does is a... how did he say it? "Stupid as fuck inbred retard." I'd have used less offensive words, but hey, you seemed to sympathize with them so you should understand that better than whatever I would have said.

Honestly I feel this dudes pain, League players this season are really "special." They refuse to listen to anything anyone says and only want to play Team Deathmatch... however they can't kill anyone any way so they just feed. Ping someone 18 pings and tell them "just back up and wave clear until I get there.." then they immediately leave the turret and fight 2v5 or 3v5 and lose the game.
